channel.title: I can't open my client batch file (HELP)
channel.description:
[code]@echo off title Deadly Client v1.00 :main cd Files JavaW -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui[/code]
It doesn't open for me, it just closes the second I open it.

item.title: I can't open my client batch file (HELP)
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

none of them work teamviewer?

Read full topic
item.source: I can't open my client batch file (HELP)

item.title: I can't open my client batch file (HELP)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude462 sk8rdude462
item.description:
@sk8rdude462 wrote:

ultimatepkvillage:

just the one Program Files

Ok now open the program files, then open the Java folder. there should be at least 2 folders. One should say jdk1.6.0_XX I put XX because the jdk version varies between people. Open the newest version of jdk that is on your computer (highest value in XX area) then open the bin folder. in there is many applications. find the one named javaw. thats what your using. Now to get the classpath for that it will look something like this: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_XX\bin (Replace the X’s) go to your compiler and change the javaw to something like this:
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_XX\bin\javaw
If that doesn’t work try setting it to this:
java
And remove all of the C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_25\bin stuff and the w after java
making your run.bat look like so:

@echo off
Title ProjectXero
java -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui
exit

Read full topic

item.title: I can't open my client batch file (HELP)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude462 sk8rdude462
item.description:
@sk8rdude462 wrote:

I’m just saying. Plus I AM trying to help. You just aren’t listening. Compiler, run.bat. Essentially the same thing. They both are batch files and both use java. So if you want help I suggest you read what I stated before and tell me if you have 1 or 2 program file folders.

item.title: I can't open my client batch file (HELP)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude462 sk8rdude462
item.description:
@sk8rdude462 wrote:

Nope. This is a compiler, if you can’t learn to fix this then you won’t learn to fix anything.
Go into your C:/ Drive. Look at the folders, is there a Program Files AND Program Files (x86) or just the one?

Read full topic
